lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

private final Ui ui = new Ui();
* duke.task.Task list to store the tasks.
private final TaskList tasks = new TaskList();

* @return The task at the specified index.

return "No tasks right now..\nHave a nice rest!";

* @param date of the task to find.
public String getbyDate(String date) throws DukeException {

* Retrieves the last message from the history.

* Creates a new task with the correct type and adds it to the list.

* @param ui    The user interface used to retrieve the last user message.
* @return {@code false} as the program should continue running.
public boolean execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui) throws DukeException {

"\n" + "Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list");
* Represents a command that can be executed within the chatbot.
* Executes the command and determining whether the program should continue running.
* @param tasks The task list that may be modified by the command.
* @param ui    The user interface for analyzing chat history.
* @return {@code true} if the program should terminate after executing this command, or
* {@code false} if the program should continue running.
boolean execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui) throws DukeException;

* Identifies the index of the task to be deleted
* with the last message and deletes it.

* @param ui    The user interface used to retrieve the last message.
* @return {@code false} as the program should continue running.

* Command use to end the program.
* Executes the exit command by sending a farewell message.
* @param tasks The task list, not used in the exit command.
* @param ui    The user interface used to send the farewell message.
* @return {@code true} as the program should terminate.
public boolean execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui) {
ui.respond("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* FindCommand to search for a task in the taskList.
public boolean execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("Please provide a keyword.\nUse [list] instead if you want to see the whole list instead.");
ui.respond("Here are the tasks that contains the keyword: "+keyword+"\n"+tasks.find(keyword));

* Command that marks a specific task.

* @param ui    The user interface used to retrieve the last message.
* @return {@code false} as the program should continue running.
public boolean execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui) throws DukeException {
ui.respond("Nice! I've marked this task as done: " + "\n" + tasks.get(index));
throw new DukeException("Wrong index. Try checking your list first.");
* Command that un-marks a specific task.
* Identifies the index of the task to be un-marked
* with the last message. Marks it as not done.
* @param tasks The task list containing the tasks.
* @param ui    The user interface used to retrieve the last message.
* @return {@code false} as the program should continue running.
public boolean execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui) throws DukeException {
ui.respond("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:" + "\n" + tasks.get(index));
throw new DukeException("Wrong index. Try checking your list first.");
